articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Strikes, Shutdowns, and Showdowns: A Tumultuous Week in US News
articles.description: A series of significant events unfolded in the US, including Starbucks worker strikes in major cities, threats of travel disruptions due to a potential government shutdown, and political tension as Trump imposes conditions on debt ceiling policies and plans to repeal the Inflation Reduction Act. Meanwhile, student debt reduction efforts continue under Biden's administration.
articles.content: Thousands of Starbucks workers across Los Angeles, Chicago, and Seattle have initiated a five-day strike, demanding resolutions on pay and staffing issues. This move echoes a growing wave of labor protests in the US service industry, driven by succes... [654 chars]

articles.author: The New York Times
articles.title: G.O.P. Spending Hawks Defy Trump on the Debt Limit, Previewing More Clashes
articles.description: President-elect Donald J. Trump is known for his tight grip on members of his party, but the rare rejection of his demand to raise the debt limit reflected a disconnect that could plague his policy agenda.
articles.content:
Something unusual happened this week after President-elect Donald J. Trump ordered House Republicans to back legislation raising the debt limit: Dozens refused.
It was a rare breach by a group of Republicans who have traditionally backed Mr. Trump’s ... [951 chars]

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: U.S. House Passes Stopgap Funding Bill Amid Trump Debt Ceiling Push
articles.description: The Republican-led House passed a funding bill to avert a government shutdown, contradicting Trump's push for a debt ceiling hike. The bill, extending funding until March 14, allocates disaster and farm aid. Democrats agree on the package despite removing controversial elements.
articles.content:
In a decisive move, the Republican-controlled U.S. House of Representatives passed a funding bill on Friday aimed at preventing a looming government shutdown, despite a push from President-elect Donald Trump to greenlight new debt measures.
The legis... [529 chars]

articles.title: House approves funding bill and sends to Senate hours before government shutdown deadline
articles.description: Hours to go before a midnight government shutdown, the House approved a new plan late Friday from Speaker Mike Johnson that would temporarily fund federal operations and disaster aid, but drops President-elect Donald Trump’s demands for a debt limit increase into the new year.

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: House Passes Shutdown Bill Amid Trump's Debt Ceiling Demand
articles.description: The U.S. House of Representatives approved a bill to prevent a government shutdown without raising the debt ceiling, opposing Trump's demands. The Senate must also pass the bill, which includes funding for disaster relief and farmers but excludes unrelated provisions. A shutdown could disrupt various sectors and cost billions.
articles.content: In a significant move, the Republican-controlled U.S. House of Representatives passed a bill on Friday to prevent a government shutdown, countering President-elect Donald Trump's demand to include provisions for raising the debt ceiling. The House ap... [932 chars]

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Cubans Rally Against U.S. Sanctions Amid Political Transition
articles.description: Tens of thousands of Cubans marched in Havana to protest U.S. sanctions as the Biden administration's term ends, worried about stricter measures under Trump. Led by Raul Castro and Miguel Diaz-Canel, protesters criticized Biden for maintaining Trump's policies and demanded an end to the economic blockade.
articles.content: Tens of thousands of Cubans took to the streets of Havana on Friday to protest against U.S. sanctions, with fears mounting over the possibility of harsher policies under incoming President Donald Trump. The protest, held in front of the U.S. embassy,... [789 chars]

articles.description: Congress devised some positions to stay on during changes in administrations. But Donald Trump has declared his intent to replace at least three.
articles.content:
President-elect Donald J. Trump has moved to install loyalists in jobs that Congress did not intend for new presidents to replace at the start of their terms, eroding a traditional constraint on executive power even before he takes office.

articles.description: The decision to withdraw the regulations seemed to be an acknowledgment that they would go nowhere under the Trump administration.
articles.content:

articles.author: Yahoo Finance
articles.title: Rumble to receive $775 million strategic investment from Tether
articles.description: Cryptocurrencies have soared since Donald Trump won the presidential election. Rumble said that following the completion of the transaction, Chris Pavlovski, Rumble's chairman and CEO, will retain his controlling stake in the company. While Tether will own a minority position in Rumble's outstanding common stock, it will not have the right to designate any members of Rumble's board.
articles.content:
(Reuters) - Video sharing platform and cloud services provider Rumble said on Friday it has entered into an agreement with Tether, a blockchain-enabled platform, to receive a strategic investment of $775 million.
